name: changesetting
desc: Escape the terminal and tweak the OS

practice.task: Settings for your computer can be controlled with the `gsettings` tool. Lets find out what you can do with `gsettings`.
practice.success: The `gsettings` tool just told you about a bunch of `commands`. You can access these commands by providing the command name as an argument to `gsettings`.
practice.fail: I thought that you were going to run `gsettings`?

practice.task: Lets try listing all the categories, called `schemas` on your system.
practice.success: Those are all the categories. Now lets look at settings you can tweak in your shell.
practice.fail: Where are my settings categories? Try running the list-schemas subcommand for gsettings

practice.task: Lets see how to use the `list-keys` subcommand. You can use the `help` command followed by a sub-command you want help for to see how to use it
practice.success: Okay, so gsettings [--schemadir SCHEMADIR] list-keys SCHEMA[:PATH] is how you do it
practice.fail: I don't know how to use this list-keys option! Get me some help for it!

practice.task: Now that we know how to use list-keys, lets list all the settings available on the org.gnome.shell category, or 'schema', as it is called. Pipe it to `sort` to get them in alphabetical order
practice.success: Interesting.... I wonder what we can play around with here...
practice.fail: I want to know about the settings available for org.gnome.shell in sorted order? Can you list-schemas on org.gnome.shell using gsettings and then pipe (|) the output to `sort`?

practice.task: Lets disable the social bar! The social bar's setting is enable-social-bar and it is a `boolean` setting, meaning it is either 'true' or 'false'. I checked `gsettings help set` for you and it said you can use the `set` command to change a setting with gsettings [--schemadir SCHEMADIR] set SCHEMA[:PATH] KEY VALUE
practice.success: There we go! No facebook icon!
practice.fail: Hmm, I thought you'd change the value of org.gnome.shell enable-social-bar to false, but it is still true

practice.task: Now lets change it back to true
practice.fail: Quick! I need facebook to come back! Change enable-social-bar on org.gnome.shell back to 'true'!

practice.task: Oh I know, we should add the Terminal to your pinned apps! To do that, we can add it to the list inside of the taskbar-pins setting. But first lets see what the taskbar-pins setting looks like.
practice.success: Okay, so it is a list in square brackets, where every element is surrounded by quotation marks and separated by a comma. Just like this: ['chromium-browser.desktop', 'my-other-app.desktop']
practice.fail: You didn't show me your pinned apps!

practice.task: Okay, lets pin the Terminal. The Terminal's App ID is 'org.gnome.Terminal', so we should add the 'org.gnome.Terminal.desktop' entry to that list in taskbar-pins
practice.success: Sweet, looks like I'll be sticking around!
practice.fail: I'm not there :( The Terminal's App ID is 'org.gnome.Terminal', so we should add the 'org.gnome.Terminal.desktop' entry to that list in taskbar-pins

done: There's a new exercise waiting for you ....
